page.title: 06CALEDONIAN CANAL
page.content: Parallel to the River Ness at Ness Side flows the{CALEDONIAN CANAL.}It was built by Thomas Telford in 1803, reconstructed and completed in 1847.This canal joins five lochs and opens up trade with the world. It is widely used today for motor boat cruising, pleasure craft, fishing boats as well as trading. There are many cruises which attract tourists to search for the{LOCH NESS MONSTER}. On the banks of the canal, just opposite Ness Side at{CLACHNAHULIG}is Sornum Boarding Kennels which can cater for 12 dogs. Building has begun to take stray dogs for Highland Regional Council. In the same district is a cattery for boarding out cats.
